column1: # Please provide an informal yet informative name of the method used.
# All major software packages used and their versions.
Alchemical free energy calculations were performed in explicit

column2: following the protocol described in [1].  We used "dry"

column1: octanol (water content 0 mol %).  Parameters were generated with  the
OPLS-AA with the TIP4P water model. Files were prepared for Gromacs
2018. The alchemical data were analyzed with thermodynamic
integration. Errors are reported as errors of the mean (see [1]). The
model uncertainty was estimated on the basis of an unpublished data
set of 92 compounds for which we computed errors for solvation free
energies in water and octanol.  [1] I. M. Kenney
I. Iorga. Prediction of cyclohexane-water distribution coefficients
for the SAMPL5 data set using molecular dynamics simulations with the
OPLS-AA force field. J Comput Aided Mol Des
